metadata.Title: CVE-2019-2228 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
In array_find of array.c, there is a possible out-of-bounds read due to an incorrect bounds check. This could lead to local information disclosure in the printer spooler with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android-8.0 Android-8.1 Android-9 Android-10Android ID: A-111210196

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-2228` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cups - 2.3.1-4
cups-bsd - 2.3.1-4
cups-client - 2.3.1-4
cups-common - 2.3.1-4
cups-core-drivers - 2.3.1-4
cups-daemon - 2.3.1-4
cups-ipp-utils - 2.3.1-4
cups-ppdc - 2.3.1-4
cups-server-common - 2.3.1-4
libcups2 - 2.3.1-4
libcupsimage2 - 2.3.1-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cups package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.3.1-4').
